intro: Rhinanthus illyricus, commonly known as the Balkan yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are bright yellow and clustered in racemes, attracting various pollinators. Rhinanthus illyricus is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of Mediterranean and continental climates.
